Soon, Jacob will get around to talking about django's ORM -- the Object Relational Mapper -- which is the part of django that transparently converts objects into database rows and back again
NoSQL is generally about nonrelational databases
But don't despair; it's really easy to use almost every nonrel DB from within django using their libraries.
For no-sql, there's a framework that let's you write "pure django" code against nosql DB: http://www.allbuttonspressed.com/projects/django-nonrel

from django.db import models

# Create your models here.
class Author(models.Model):
	first_name = models.CharField(max_length=200)
	last_name = models.CharField(max_length=200)
	bio = models.TextField(blank=True)
